file_content.text: My probes notified me of your success. Not a moment too soon, by the looks of you.
Just hurry, Doctor. I want this over with.
These better work this time.
It appears my predictions proved accurate. I'll have to count my lucky stars tonight.
We should test them before we start celebrating.
Too true.
Take them. The stench is killing me.
Have I mentioned that rakghouls primarily hunt by smell?
You've never scoured the aftermath of firaxan shark spawning frenzy.
This had better be worth the trouble.
Has my grapple with mortality burdened you? I'll try dying more conveniently in the future. If I have one.
Not my first choice for sample preservation, but remarkably effective. I may have to consider sarlaccs for discreet storage in the future.
It's a bit early to be thinking of the future. Check the viability of your samples.
Promise not to come to me if you do.
Honestly, I'm interested to see for myself.
That may be the most disgusting thing I've ever experienced. And I've been undercover on Hutta.
I'll have to identify the genes responsible for your hardy constitution.
Let's see what you've pulled from the jaws of death.
You're quite lucky. What you gathered was exactly what I needed. This serum should counteract the infection.
Doesn't it feel nice to have the weight of your own mortality lifted from your shoulders?
I feel... tired.
Yes... it's light... dizzy... am I okay?
Yes, you'll be just fine.
What... what did you do...?
Don't worry, you're in no danger.
The sedative will slow your mind and movements, but it causes no permanent harm. Just a precaution, in case you were still harboring any aggressive inclinations toward me.
We got off on the wrong foot, but you've been quite useful, so I'm willing to forgive and forget.
This was... a trick....
We both benefited from your work.
Fine... we'll call it even....
Apology accepted.
Forgive...! After this...?
Emotional for a Jedi.
It's a lot to ask from a Sith, I know.
I see you're the emotional type.
By the time you awaken I will be gone. My fallow years at an end and possessed of a new lease on life.
I could go anywhere, do anything. Where do you suggest, Commander?
Odessen... fight... Zakuul.
Trade the sound of the sea breeze through the grass for the dank of a foxhole? The gentle warmth of the sun for the glow of a datapad?
I believe I shall.
[Reject Companion] To... hell...!
If that's what you wanted, all you had to do was wait.
Next time we cross paths, I hope your mood will have improved. Else I may have to kill you.
The moment of truth. I don't anticipate a volatile reaction, but... a little space might do.
Warm, but not unpleasant. Pulse: elevated. No swelling at the injection site. That will do.
Some of my cells are showing signs of restoration. The gene therapy appears to be working.
I've held up my end of the bargain.
That's it? You're cured?
It's time to put that genius to work for me.
I suppose I owe you that much.
That's good news. How long until you have fully recovered?
In a few days the serum should have permeated my system. A week, and my body will have purged my cancers.
What if it doesn't take?
I can rule out complete rejection, but in the event my healing is incomplete I should be able to try variants until I achieve the desired result.
I hope this is the last time you meddle with the fabric of your being.
It's sad that SCORPIO was the only one to ever understand my interest in self-improvement.
I can already feel the strength seeping back into me. I'll be in top condition before you know it.
This was a nice place to escape, but I don't think retirement suits me. Not yet.
I'll join you on Odessen once I've swept the traces of this life away.
I received signals from my probes indicating a successful harvest.
Let me test these samples' viability for your treatment.
I need to run some tests to see whether these samples will help my condition.
Excellent work as always, Cipher. Give me some time to analyze these samples.
No good. This strain has mutated too far from its origin to be useful.
It was a good effort, but these samples don't possess the properties I need to continue my research.
Good news: I'm confident that Lorrick's work will lead to a cure. Bad news: the samples you retrieved have mutated too far from my strain.
We'll have to try a different source.
If you know of one, tell me already.
Even if we find one, what's to say it won't be mutated as well?
You are correct, most sources would bear the same results, save one.
You promised me a cure!
And you'll have it.
Where next then? Taris?
The Taris strain is likely too close to my initial formula to see results. I need a sample of Lorrick's virus that's been preserved.
We'll find the answer. I promise you.
You might not be so motivated after hearing what I have to say next.
You're likely to see the same results.
From strains that have been evolving over the years, yes, but not a preserved sample.
Do you know of another one?
It may be our final option.
Are you sure what you're looking for even exists?
I have enough understanding of my condition to know what I'm looking for.
I fear there's only one place we can still find it: a sarlacc.
You keep rakghouls as pets and sent me for biological samples at an outbreak location. What aren't you telling me?
I'm suffering from complications of my own exposure to the virus. It was controlled, but that's no longer the case. Understand my discretion?
I believe there is one place where we can still find the strain that we need: a sarlacc.
Recall the outbreak on Tatooine? If an infected creature was eaten by a sarlacc it would still be alive, even today.
Any creature consumed by a sarlacc is slowly digested, alive, over a period of time long exceeding its natural longevity.
With Lorrick's lab long since destroyed, it's the only place I can think of where a live sample might be found.
How do we get what you need from a sarlacc?
I can't believe that makes sense.
You don't expect me to get eaten by that monster, do you?
The probes I gave you should be able to traverse a sarlacc's digestive tract safely, provided you deploy them nearby.
In the event they can't... well, more invasive action may need to be taken. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.
My stores are fully stocked. All we need are the right samples and a cure will be within our reach.
I'd say I've got about half of what I'll need to carry me through.
I'm still short on raw materials. I'll need those as much as the samples to make progress.
[Give Metamorphic Cell Cultures]
This will help. My thanks.
I don't have anything for you.
Then come back when you do.
No breakthroughs yet. The materials I need are difficult to obtain, so progress is slow.
I'm ready to help you, Doctor.
Excellent.
[Refuse Quest] Keep at it, Lokin.
Encouragement is not what I need. If you don't have anything for me, please leave me to my work.
Few people realize the kind of protective instincts rakghouls display for their pack. A rare loyalty these days.
Careful. Strike two will be your last. Have the scratches begun to itch yet?
You'll find any THORN inoculations rather impotent in combating the strain coursing through your body.
You have a cure. You wouldn't risk letting them roam otherwise.
And what if I'm just mad?
What are you?
A monster. But not an unreasonable one. Count yourself fortunate there.
You filthy son of a gundark!
I'm afraid I share no genetic stock with those simple creatures.
I have the means to save you from the gruesome fate that awaits, but it will require more materials than I have on hand.
It seems you've just volunteered yourself to replenish my stock.
What do I need to do?
You're lying!
I haven't needed a cure for a very long time.
I'll kill you for this.
When the virus begins to alter your brain, you won't even have the capacity to remember me. All the more reason to cooperate.
I'd suggest you bring me whatever biochem supplies you can spare, but I'll also need new viral samples to work with.
Follow THORN's broadcasts--they'll deploy their Spike anywhere a rakghoul outbreak is detected. Activate my probes in the rakghouls' tunnels, and they might locate useful samples.
If they don't?
Then we look elsewhere. Quickly.
Can't you use the virus from your pets?
They will prove useful, but they won't be enough to cure you.
I'll begin my preparations.
I don't get many visitors out this way. A delivery droid, a roosting thranta, the odd sail-speeder.
Momentary distractions, not always unwelcome.
But you, I'm actually pleased to see. It's good to know I'll only have to drink for Cipher Twelve in the future.
It seems I've beaten the odds yet again.
I think we can safely rule out luck at this point.
I'm flattered you kept up the tradition.
Give yourself more credit. So long as I linger, I'll remember our time fondly.
You were always eccentric, but never so sloppy. What possessed you to leave rakghouls on the loose?
I've never had the pleasure of a Jedi's company for my afternoon recess. I have a sealed tin of jeru tea awaiting such an occasion.
A visit from a Sith of your station, however, is quite unexpected. Welcome to my humble abode, my lord. May I offer you some dianogan tea?
I appreciate the hospitality, but that isn't necessary.
Pity. I find tea to be a remarkable emollient. Nothing unfurrows a brow quite like it.
I'll accept nothing from a man who keeps rakghouls running free.
Most aren't so well-armed. Should I be concerned?
Are you Doctor Eckard Lokin?
Very well, we'll pretend you've come all this way without already knowing the answer and I'll humor you for the sake of civility.
I haven't come to cause you any trouble.
Oh good, I'm quite sure that would have put a damper on my tea time.
If I don't like your explanation for the rakghouls, you might.
Don't mind my pets--they were created with a modified strain. Sterile. Harmless. Forty-eight hours after transformation the virus can no longer reproduce.
Kowakian monkey-lizards originally. I find them much less obnoxious in this form. They're also remarkably good for pest control.
To what do I owe this visitation?
I'm organizing an Alliance against the Eternal Empire. I've been told you're a good man to have.
Then you haven't been told nearly enough.
I still have need of your skills, Eckard. Now more than ever.
Who says I'm not just sightseeing?
By all means take in the sights and be on your way.
Perhaps I've simply come to see my old friend?
Perhaps, but we both know you haven't.
I just want to know more about the man who owns this place.
Just an old retiree trying to escape the tiresome bother of a galaxy in constant strife. I'm certain you'd find me quite boring.
It's been nice to have made your acquaintance. If you'll excuse me, I have some things to attend to.
Please, Doctor. The galaxy is at stake. Don't pretend it has nothing to do with you.
Age and infirmity have a way of narrowing one's concerns.
Okay, wait. I came here to recruit you. The Alliance needs your expertise to combat the Eternal Empire.
And I suppose you don't intend to simply take "no" for an answer.
My health is failing, and I'm afraid that conventional medicine isn't up to the task of stopping my inexorable slide toward oblivion.
This is the place I've chosen to die, should I fail to synthesize an elixir.
You believe you can find a cure for your condition?
I'm nothing if not a survivor.
I didn't realize. My condolences.
I really shouldn't complain. I've led a long and interesting life, but that offers little comfort when death looms.
So you'd rather squeeze a few more years out of your life than ensure a better future?
If there's going to be a better future, I intend to see it with my own eyes.
You have greater troubles on your mind than the travails of an old man... but if you want my help, I want yours first.
Assist me in discovering my cure and you'll have more than my gratitude.
Alright, Doctor. You have a deal.
I need biological samples. Both raw materials and unique specimens.
Bring the more common items whenever you have some to spare. As for my special needs, take these collection probes.
Follow THORN's broadcasts--they'll deploy their Spike anywhere a rakghoul outbreak is detected. Activate my probes in the rakghouls' tunnels, and they'll gather cultures I may be able to use.
[Refuse Quest] That's not something I have time for.
Then I must return to finding the answer myself. You know where to find me should you reconsider.
[Draw Weapon] Drop the act.
Remember how I said the rakghouls were harmless?
I lied.
You really shouldn't have done that.
Just keeping tabs on you, Doctor. Like old times.
I'd come to miss your watchful eye. The game's so boring when played alone.
If I told you that I got out and retired to this pristine wilderness for a well-deserved rest, would you believe me?
It's closer to the truth than you think. I'm dying.
I'm sure the cause is no mystery. What's your diagnosis?
I'm sorry. Is there anything that can be done?
Something can always be done. The question is: do I have the will and ingenuity to succeed?
Then it's all the more important that you put the time you have left to good use.
Agreed, but you should know by now that selfless sacrifice holds no appeal for me.
The alterations I've made to my genes are fraying. With each division, my cells introduce more errors. Cancer is the best I can hope for.
Treating the damaged sequences using the strains I have on hand has proven fruitless. I need a stronger virus.
That will be difficult to come by. Outbreaks are eradicated with prejudice.
Yes, THORN is aptly named.
I don't think I like where this is going.
No, I imagine you wouldn't.
This is what you get for using yourself as a test subject.
It was a calculated risk. This life was becoming far too dangerous for an old man.
The rakghoul strain Sannus Lorrick released years back is perhaps my only hope. I need you to harvest any samples you can find.
Follow THORN's broadcasts. Activate these probes in the tunnels anywhere they deploy their Spike. It's all I ask.
Child's play. I'll contact you when it's finished.
Thank you, Cipher.
Let's get you fixed, old friend.
I'm sorry you have to see me in this state.
[Refuse Quest] That's not something I can do right now.
That's disappointing, Cipher. There's time yet for me--you know what I'll be devoting it to.
Lovely day. Of course, they're all lovely out here.
You needn't worry--I'm in no danger of becoming a mindless beast. Only a corpse. Good luck.
You can use these probes to retrieve viable samples. I've prepared a list of locations with potential for useful material. Take a look--it's all I ask.
The probes will scan for useful samples and retrieve them. I've prepared a list of potential harvest sites. Good luck.
I've prepared a list of potential harvest sites. These probes should be able to locate and retrieve the materials I'll need.
[Give Anodyne Extract]
There's actually an extra signal coming from.... Now that's above and beyond. I must confess I'm a tad impressed.
There's actually an extra signal coming from... Cipher, you'd go so far for me?
Perhaps it's just the pending mortality speaking, but... honestly I'm a bit touched.
I know, I must be going soft.
Anything for you, old friend.
What can I say, you're my favorite monster.
Perfect. Thank you.
I've been infected before, on Taris. I was cured.
Cured of one strain, perhaps. But not this one.
[Give Autoimmune Regulators]
[Give Hemostatic Gel]
[Give Rakghoul DNA Canister] What about this?
[Give Symbiotic Fungal Bloom] Is this useful?
[Give Exotic Plague Specimen] Can you use this?
[Limit: 1][Give Barnacle of the Eyeless] Look what I found.
I'll be back soon.
